metadata.name: Dashíkí I
metadata.description:
Dashíkí (Space) - In Color and Harmony Series

The Yoruba loaned the word dashiki from the Hausa term dan ciki, which means "underneath”. Dashiki, used to refer to the loose-fitting pullover, a functional work tunic for men, comfortable enough to wear in the heat.  
The Dashiki moved beyond style to functionality.

This collection features unique pieces from an imaginative state of a colorful and harmonious world Exploring beings who significantly is wearing African motifs and patterns, heavy jewelries and vibrant colors. Dressed up to identify indifference.
